Name: Single
Def: Hits on which the batter reached first base safely without the contribution of a fielding error.

Name: Double
Def: Hits on which the batter reached second base safely without the contribution of a fielding error.

Name: Triple
Def: Hits on which the batter reached third base safely without the contribution of a fielding error.

Name: At bat
Def: Batting appearances, not including bases on balls, hit by pitch, sacrifices, interference, or obstruction.

Name: At bats per home run
Def: At bats divided by home runs.

Name: Batting average
Def: Hits divided by bats.

Name: Base on balls (walk)
Def: Times receiving four balls and advancing to first base.

Name: Walk-to-strikeout ratio
Def: Number of base on balls divided by number of strikeouts.

Name: Extra base hits
Def: Doubles plus triples plus home runs.

Name: Fielder's choice
Def: Times reaching base when a fielder chose to try for an out on another runner.

Name: Ground ball fly ball ratio
Def: Number of ground ball outs divided by number of fly ball outs.

Name: Grounded into double play
Def: Number of ground balls hit that became double plays.

Name: Grand Slam
Def: A home run with the bases loaded, resulting in four runs scoring, and four RBI credited to the batter.

Name: Hits
Def: Times reached base because of a batted, fair ball without error by the defense.

Name: Hit by pitch
Def: Times touched by a pitch and awarded first base as a result.

Name: Home runs
Def: Hits on which the batter successfully touched all four bases, without the contribution of a fielding error.

Name: Intentional base on balls
Def: A base on balls (see BB above) deliverately thrown by the pitcher. Anso known as intentional walk.

Name: Strike out
Def: Number of times that strike three is taken or swung and missed, or bunted foul.

Name: Left on base
Def: Number of runners not out nor scored at the end of an inning.

Name: On base percentage
Def: Times reached base (H + BB + HBP) divided by at bats plus walks plus hit my pitch plus sacrifice flies (AB + BB + HBP + SF).

Name: On-base plus slugging
Def: On-base percentage plus slugging average.

Name: Plate appearance
Def: Number of completed batting appearances.

Name: Runs created
Def: Statistic that attempts to measure how many runs a player has contributed to his team.

Name: Run batted in
Def: Number of runners who scored due to a batter's action, except when batter grounded into double play or reached on an error.

Name: Sacrafice fly
Def: Number of fly ball outs which allow another runner to advance on the basepaths or score.

Name: Sacrifice hit
Def: Number of sacrifice bunts which allows another runner to advance on the basepaths or score.

Name: Slugging average
Def: Total bases divided by at-bats.

Name: Total average
Def: Total bases, plus walks, plus steals, divided by plate appearances plus caught stealing.

Name: Total bases
Def: One for each single, two for each double, three for each triple, and four for each home run.

Name: Times on base
Def: Times reaching base as a result of hits, walks, and hit-by-pitches.

Name: Caught stealing
Def: Times tagged out when attempting to steal.

Name: Stolen base
Def: Number of bases advanced other than on batted balls, walks, or hits by pitch.

Name: Runs scored
Def: Times reached home base legally and safely.

Name: Batting average on balls in play
Def: Batting average against a pitcher on batted balls ending a plate appearance, excluding home runs.

Name: Base on balls
Def: Times pitching four balls, allowing the batter-runner to advance to first base.

Name: Base on balls per 9 innings pitched
Def: Base on balls times nine divided by innings pitched.

Name: Total batters faced
Def: Opponent's total plate appearances.

Name: Balk
Def: Number of times pitcher commits an illegal pitching action or other illegal action while in contact with the pitching rubber, thus allowing baserunners to advance.

Name: Blown save
Def: Number of times entering the game in a save situation, and being charged the run which ties the game.

Name: Component ERA
Def: An estimate of a pitcher's ERA based upon the individual components of his statistical line (K, H, 2B, 3B, HR, BB, HBP).

Name: Complete game
Def: Number of games where player was the only pitcher for his team.

Name: Defense-Independent Component ERA
Def: An estimate of a pitcher's ERA based upon the defense-independent components of his statistical line (K, HR, BB, HBP).

Name: Earned run
Def: Number of runs that did not occur as a result of errors or passed balls.

Name: Earned run average
Def: Earned runs times innings in a game (usually nine) divided by innings pitched.

Name: Games pitched
Def: Number of times a pitcher pitches in a season.

Name: Games finished
Def: Number of games pitched where player was the final pitcher for his team.

Name: Ground ball fly ball ratio
Def: Ground balls allowed divided by fly balls allowed.

Name: Starts
Def: Number of games pitched where player was the first pitcher for his team.

Name: Hits per nine innings
Def: Hits allowed times nine divided by innings pitched.

Name: Hits allowed
Def: Total hits allowed.

Name: Hit batsman
Def: Times hit a batter with pitch, allowing runner to advance to first base.

Name: Hold
Def: Number of games entered in a save situation, left in save situation, recorded at lease one out, and not having surrendured the lead.

Name: Home runs allowed
Def: Total home runs allowed.

Name: Intentional base on balls
Def: Intentional base on balls allowed.

Name: Inherited runners
Def: Number of runners on base when the pitcher enters the game.

Name: Inherited runs allowed
Def: Number of inherited runners allowed to score.

Name: Innings pitched
Def: Number of outs recorded while pitching divided by three.

Name: Innings pitched per game
Def: Average number of innings pitched per game.

Name: Strikeout
Def: Number of batters who received strike three.

Name: Strikeouts per nine innings
Def: Strikeouts times nine divided by innings pitched.

Name: Strikeout-to-walk ratio
Def: Number of strikeouts divided by number of base on balls.

Name: Loss
Def: Number of games where pitcher was pitching while the opposing team took the lead, never lost the lead, and went on to win.

Name: Opponents batting average
Def: Hits allowed divided by at-bats faced.

Name: Pitch count
Def: Pitches thrown.

Name: Runs average
Def: Number of runs allowed times nine divided by innings pitched.

Name: Runs against average
Def: A sabermetric statistic to predict win-percentage.

Name: Shutout
Def: number of ocmplete games pitched with no runs allowed.

Name: Save
Def: Number of games where the pitcher enters a game led by the pitcher's team, finishes the game without surrendering the lead, is not the winning pitcher, and either (a) the lead was three runs or less when the pitcher entered the game; (b) the potential tying run was on base, at bat, or on deck; or (c) the pitcher pitched three or more innings.

Name: Win
Def: Number of games where pitcher was pitching while his team took the lead and went on to win.

Name: Wild pitches
Def: Charged when a pitch ist oo high, low, or wide of home plate for the catcher to field, thereby allowing one or more runners to advance or score.

Name: Assists
Def: Number of outs recorded on a play where a fielder touched the ball, except if such touching is the putout.

Name: Double plays
Def: One for each double play during which the fielder recorded a putout or an assist.

Name: Errors
Def: Number of times a fielder fails to make a play he should have made with common effort, and the offense benefits as a result.

Name: Fielding percentage
Def: Total plays (chances minus errors) divided by the number of total chances.

Name: Innings
Def: Number of innings that a player is at one certain position.

Name: Passed ball
Def: Charged to the catcher when the ball is dropped and one or more runners advance.

Name: Putout
Def: Number of times the fielder tags, forces, or appeals a runner and he is called out as a result.

Name: Range factor
Def: Used to determine the amount of field that he player can cover. ([putouts + assists]*9)/innings played.

Name: Stolen bases
Def: Number of times a runner advanced on the pitch without being thrown out by the catcher.

Name: Total chances
Def: Assists plus putouts plus errors.

Name: Triple play
Def: One for each triple play during which the fielder recorded a putout or an assist.

Name: Games played
Def: Number of games where the player played, in whole or in part.
